pullRequest.body:
This is a smaller version of #7020. Before this PR, for limits, we gave instances for small indexing categories, but for colimits, we gave instances for `TypeMax`. This PR changes so that we give instances for small indexing categories in both cases. This is more general and also more uniform.

Co-authored-by: JoÃ«l Riou <rioujoel@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Recently, I have thought that it was possible to have an even more uniform approach. In https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/jriou_localization/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/IsColimitType.lean I show that if `F : J â¥¤ Type w` (with `J : Type u` and `[Category.{v} J]`), then `HasColimit F â†” Small.{w} (Quot' F)` where `Quot'` is the obvious quotient (in whichever universe it may be), and a cocone `c` is colimit iff the obvious map from `Quot' F` to `c.pt` is a bijection. Then, in particular, this should apply when `J` is `w`-small.
@joelriou Thanks, I have added versions of your `isColimit_iff` results.

This looks good to me, but as I have made a nontrivial contribution, I would rather let another maintainer process this.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joelriou.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8255115654/job/22580853779)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8255115654/job/22580853528)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8255115654/job/22580853288)

This theorem is very nice! I think it can be used to golf the [`PreservesColimitsOfSize uliftFunctor` instance](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/08a5f163f734c599f0f7eb942bd2e2ae8b2e09d4/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Preserves/Ulift.lean#L138-L145), if you establish the Equiv between `Quot F` and `Quot (F â‹™ uliftFunctor)` and the commuting square formed by it with the two `Quot.desc`s and `Equiv.ulift`. If you do so, feel free to remove the auxiliary constructions/lemmas used to prove the instance.
I agree that this is a good idea, but I would prefer to keep this PR as small as possible and defer further refactorings to future PRs.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: generalize universes for colimits in Type

nodes.body: Recently, I have thought that it was possible to have an even more uniform approach. In https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/jriou_localization/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/IsColimitType.lean I show that if `F : J â¥¤ Type w` (with `J : Type u` and `[Category.{v} J]`), then `HasColimit F â†” Small.{w} (Quot' F)` where `Quot'` is the obvious quotient (in whichever universe it may be), and a cocone `c` is colimit iff the obvious map from `Quot' F` to `c.pt` is a bijection. Then, in particular, this should apply when `J` is `w`-small.

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: generalize universes for commuting filtered colimits and finite limits
